text.text: The Importance of Community Engagement and Building Relationships

Community engagement is essential for the overall success of building resilience in your community. Without community engagement, you may be missing people who should be involved in the decision-making process. You may also unintentionally ignore important perspectives represented in your community; like local priorities and threats. The following list are other examples of the benefits of community engagement:
- Helps to build relationships and trust between you and your community, which in turn can decrease community stress and conflict.
- Keeps community members informed about planning processes and progress.
- Provides opportunities to gather input/feedback on approaches.
- Empower historically under-valued or under-represented community groups.
- Expand capability of the resilience planning team to get things accomplished.
